notesStmt.note: Incipits, first word of a new paragraph, in slightly enlarged characters placed above a space; Contains the last lines of the preliminary prayer לעולם יהא אדם (Midrash Tana deṿe Eliyahu 22 as in ʹAmram Gaʾon and Solomon of Sujulmassa), and the beginning Pesuḳe de-zimrah; The latter is precluded by the editor's note, instructing to install here the prayers עלינו, אוחילה לאל, ואל כן נקוה. This matches the complete sequence from the beginning of the Malkhiyot segment of Musaf of Rosh ha-shanah; The Pesuke de-zimrah segment is introduced by a much expanded version (47 lines) of ברוך שאמר, followed by הודו (Psalm CV, the fragment ends in verse 2 ישמח לב).No. 175 continues to the end of this same prayer, followed by the beginning of Psalm XXX (starts here verse 2 ארומימך).
